stream_context.summary: Kaze reviews and integrates Biobak’s large graphic/level update for “Wario’s Wildlife World” (the zoo) while hunting down engine bugs, tweaking Antarctic plane-mini-game, and discussing upcoming multiplayer and testing plans.

development_findings.summary: Kaze finished ‘a lot of stuff’ needed for the future multiplayer build and insists it be inside the main ROM, not a separate one.
development_findings.quote: I have prepared a lot of stuff that we need to do in order to get multiplayer in … making it a separate ROM kind of feels like cheating to me.

development_findings.summary: Scene-transition system now uses radius-scaling for smoother wipes, borrowed from Zeina’s code.
development_findings.quote: Oh, yeah, I didn’t mention that, but we have smoother transitions now. Look at that.

development_findings.summary: Monthly single-course testing will return: each month one isolated level ROM will be sent to a player for gameplay feedback.
development_findings.quote: I think we’re gonna bring back monthly course testing, where a player will just get to test one course at a time.

development_findings.summary: Large zoo re-work from Biobak integrated: new textures, benches, bushes, aquarium decorations, broken car, chain-chomp gate, tire swing, prison overhaul, etc.
Kaze fixes UV-mapping seams, mis-named textures and disables Fast64 ‘culling’ on many models because it breaks render on N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: Culling kind of just loads 0x80 vertices for no reason. It doesn’t do anything.

development_findings.summary: New ‘butt-print’ texture (12×12 transparent dot) added for ground-pound and sliding traces.
development_findings.quote: Alright, I’m making a butt print … It needs to be a transparent dot like this.

development_findings.summary: Aquarium glass now needs reflective/tinted material; Cheep-Cheep and Unagi models updated; manta splines may need adjustment.
Antarctic plane mini-game tuning: water scroll/fog mismatch fixed; fish wave offset, timer, neutral-zone size under review.
development_findings.quote: I always end with 15 seconds in the end! The fact that you get stuck … is what makes it harder.

development_findings.summary: Behaviour-script interaction bug (NPCs couldn’t talk) traced to object-field overlap (0x3E vs 0x40) after recent refactor; fixed live.
development_findings.quote: The current behavior comment is being set to zero. … I guess I have to keep this at 0x40.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 update broke armature bones in Dory and other models; Kaze patches by removing extra bones and adjusting offsets.
Engine and full hack will be open-sourced; Kaze mentions need for a better random() implementation.
development_findings.quote: The entire hack here will be open source.

development_findings.summary: Performance/size optimisations: consolidate textures into CI8, avoid multiple materials on armatures; discussion about using ‘const’.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s design philosophy opposes modern ‘frustration-minimised’ games; he prefers risk and player struggle.
context_findings.quote: I think modern video games are just frustration-minimized … I try not to do that.

context_findings.summary: He values direct negative feedback over empty praise for improving level design.
context_findings.quote: If your level is shit and people tell you it’s shit … That’s the most useful thing you can get.

context_findings.summary: Debug style: fix specific change quickly instead of full regression tests; says exhaustive checking is unreasonable.
context_findings.quote: Checking the entire game would have taken longer than just fixing it. I know exactly what I changed.

context_findings.summary: Shows pragmatic attitude toward hardware: keeps cheap spare mice in ‘pipeline’ to avoid downtime.
context_findings.quote: I always have one in store … I call this pipelining mice.

context_findings.summary: Open about not engaging with charity trends; values authenticity over public image.
context_findings.quote: I don’t really care about charity … I don’t like pretending to care when I don’t.

biobak.summary: Delivered massive rework package for zoo, aquarium, prison, Antarctic plane course, chain-chomp gate, tire swing, etc.
Reduced polycounts and merged textures (e.g., chain-chomp teeth/body) to save performance.
Adds humorous environmental storytelling (signs, trophy statues, garlic plate in Wario’s office).

zeina.summary: Created new butt-print texture and ensured symmetry.
zeina.quote: Just sent you a new butt print … it’s all symmetrical this time.

zeina.summary: Animating Mario shuffle dance using new per-frame streaming system; also making Wario run cycle; credits Yoshi Milkman IK rig.
zeina.quote: We’re basically using a new technique where instead of loading the entire animation at once, we’re loading individual frames … so you can make it as long as you want.

key_stories.title: The Great Zoo Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Biobak ships a huge visual update for the zoo. On stream Kaze reviews every asset, fixes UV seams, adjusts shading and collision, and marvels at the new humor and life the level now has.
key_stories.challenge: Original zoo looked flat and inconsistent.
key_stories.process: Biobak rebuilt textures and models; Kaze live-debugged UVs, fog, culling, and collision; discussed interactions like Chain-Chomp pillow bounce.
key_stories.outcome: Level feels ‘so much more alive’; only collision and a few materials remain before it’s final.
key_stories.key_quote: The level looks so much more alive now.

key_stories.title: The Vanishing NPC Bug
key_stories.summary: NPC dialogue suddenly stopped working. Live, Kaze isolates the cause to an object-field overlap that zeroed the behavior-script pointer.
key_stories.challenge: Player couldn’t talk to penguins, blocking prison entrance.
key_stories.process: Used debugger to inspect object memory; found damage/current value field collided with behavior script pointer; changed offset from 0x3E to 0x40.
key_stories.outcome: Interaction restored; highlights dangers of inline changes.
key_stories.key_quote: The current behavior comment is being set to zero … That explains the crash.

key_stories.title: Pipeline Mice
key_stories.summary: Kaze’s mouse fails mid-stream; he reveals his ‘pipelining mice’ strategy: always keep a $10 spare.
key_stories.challenge: Broken hardware would slow development on-air.
key_stories.process: Unplugs defective mouse, plugs spare, orders new one immediately.
key_stories.outcome: Stream continues smoothly; shows pragmatic, low-budget workflow.
key_stories.key_quote: Imagine if they did that on the submarine—they could have survived.
